data.title: A good burger joint with very polite student staff
data.text: The place is always crowded, which tells you that the food and service are good.  They will fix your burger anyway you want it (lettuce wrap, etc.) without any questions.  Even on a crowded night, they seem to keep the line moving and get your order delivered quickly.

data.title: Hmmmm
data.text: Ok so it's a good burger... but I would take whataburger any day over it! Sorry but true! I do like the dressing on the burgerit adds flavor.

data.title: Long lines but great fast food!
data.text:
I usually don't like coming to In & out burger because the lines are just crazy! I mean you would think that this place was the only place on earth to eat!! Lol. Seriously though, The food is cooked fresh and to your preference. The menu is small but to the point. They only serve the traditional Burgers and fries with the usual soft drinks. They also have shakes! That's about all that they have on the menu. I hear they have a secret menu though and you can customize your order to have grilled onions added to the fries maybe even some of the spread. I think they call then animal fries. Anyways for such a small menu this place is never lacking in customers that's for sure!! Lol. 
A great place to eat for larger families or even just a quick bite! So if you like hamburgers or cheeseburgers and fries In-N-Out is the place to try!!

data.title: If you have been, you already know.  In case you haven't
data.text:
In-N-Out specializes in only a few menu items.  Burgers, fries, and shakes.  All ingredients are all fresh (maybe not the pickles/ketchup packets/buns) and prepped in the restaurant.  The burgers a bit on the small side so go for a "double-double" if you are very hungry.  My favorite are the fries.  Because the fries are fresh and may have been cut just minutes before dropping into the fryer, they are ONLY GOOD for about 2-3 minutes before going stale.  

You will not get a higher quality "fast food" burger anywhere.

data.title: Excellent small hamburgers
data.text: When I'm in the mood, stop here for several small hamburgers and excellent french fries. Very nicely prepared. Everything tastes fresh and the place is immacualate. Simple menu, just hamburgers, but really good ones.

data.title: Made to order
data.text:
When my health required a no salt diet, this was one of the few places where I could ask them to not include salt in the fries or hamburger.  This was a big benefit during this time because otherwise, fast food take out would have been greatly limited.

Another item - bring your sweater when you go to the San Ramon In-N-Out.  For some reason, it is always cold inside!

data.title: Best burgers in San Ramon
data.text: This is a great spot as evidence by the lines for drive thru and eat in.  Consistent high quality and friendly service.  This is probably the best In and Out in the whole Bay area and I've been to all of them.  Best time to go is early evening in the summer months when you can watch the sun set behind the hills and the Mt Diablo glow in the evening light.

data.title: Burgers to go
data.text: Always consistently good burgers, not a big fan of the fries. And the drive-thru line out into the street tells the popularity tale. Don't go if you have a tight lunch break at noon, as the wait can be long.

data.title: Fresh and good and cheap
data.text:
If you like your burger fresh with crisp lettuce, a great tomato slice, and a toasted bun, then you will love In-and-out Burger. Burger and a drink for under $5.
The biggest issue with In-and-out is the line for the drive through. There is almost always a line.  They do have efficient systems to get the line moving and very hard working staff.  You can also actually get out of your car.
The fries are great too but I can't eat fries. I just remember them.

data.title: The best burger ever!
data.text: Make sure you ask for your burger "animal style".  It's not on the menu, but all In-N-Out lovers know it's the best way to get your burger.  The onions are grilled, vs raw, there are pickles on it, vs none, and then mustard is grilled onto the meat patty for a mouth watering, yummy taste.  It's the only way to go.  I'm not a pickle lover, so I always ask for mine "animal style no pickles", and it is never a problem.  All their employees are polite and a joy to order with.  I know you'll love these burgers.  They also have a vegetarian burger and the best real ice cream shakes.

data.title: Can't Get Enough!!
data.text: This very special location if right off the 680 Highway off of Crow Canyon Blvd. It even has it's own "merge" lane into the drive thru because of demand. No matter how long the line is, they get you "In-N-Out" efficiently and our order is always correct even with all the special instructions that my family challenges them with on an ongoing basis! A true treat and a nice break for me when I have no dinner made!

data.title: True comfort food....
data.text: Don't know about the nutritional aspect of a burger, but the taste certainly covers a "myriad of sins!" and the added cheese?   Well......what can I say.   They  make a delicious burger and sometimes a gal has to do what a gal has to do, and that's get in that increasingly loooooonng line for the drive-thru.   By the time you get up to the box to order, you are so hungry that anything would taste good.  In all seriousness, it took my 49 minutes from the time I entered the line until I got to place my order.....and that was at 1:30 in the afternoon!!!   Do I like In-N-Out Burger?  I guess I'd have to admit that I do....do I like giving up almost an hour of my day to sit in a drive-thru line?  NO!!!  Therefore, I feel that I MUST take away one point and give them an "AVERAGE" review.  Sorry.

data.title: My first IN 'n' OUT burger, Very tasty!
data.text:
Very good burgers & fries.
ALWAYS crowded, but that's a good sign.
Excellent service. Even though it was crowded, I quickly got my food. Delicious fresh burgers.

data.title: Best Burger. Period!
data.text:
Still the best burger you can get. No fuss, no special monster gig a super duper menus or fancy sandwiches. 
2 different Burgers add onions and fries. That's it. That's all it needs. 😉

data.title: As good as they claim!!
data.text: This was my daughter's first time and my second eating at an In-N-Out and we both absolutely loved it!  This is saying a lot since my daughter is absolutely and extremely picky eater.

data.title: The only fast food I'll eat
data.text: Just the best. I don't like burgers with huge patties, so these are perfect! Love the 1000 island on them too!

data.title: In-N-Out Business Trip
data.text: I fly into the Bay Area once a year for a very short business trip.  My plane lands around 11 am, I go pick up my rental car and then make my annual pilgrimage to In-N-Out Burger.  I don't have them on the East Coast so it is a nice change of pace to stop in when I am out here on business.  The food is very good and the value is excellent.  I also like the fact that it is still a family owned business trying to do things the right way.

data.title: Excellent as always
data.text:
Sometimes its faster to just park then the long car line that extends onto the street.
Not as long a line as some others.

data.title: soggy fries
data.text: We stayed across the street so I decided to check out this place which always had a line. i don't get the hype. The line of cars was out to the road. I placed my order with the guy that was standing outside, paid the cashier and then got my food (at least 15 minutes from start to finish). The fries were soggy and the burgers didn't taste like anything special.

data.title: Tasty bites
data.text: Tasty and quick, just like the name. My kiddo really liked the burgers and the grown-ups weren't disappointed either!
